commonIssues.issue: Bolts are hard to thread / T-nuts keep popping out
symptoms: Bolts won't catch the T-nut threads
T-nuts pop out of the channel when trying to thread
Ball bearing springs on T-nuts are weak
solutions: Use a small flat-head screwdriver to hold the T-nut in place while starting the bolt
Pre-position T-nuts in the channel before attempting to thread
Apply gentle downward pressure on the bolt while turning to help it catch
For stubborn T-nuts, use masking tape to temporarily hold them in position
If spring is weak, replace T-nut from hardware store (standard 40-series T-nut)
preventionTips: Don't fully tighten bolts until all are started
Have a magnetic parts tray to avoid losing small hardware
commonIssues.escalation: If consistently failing, contact support for replacement hardware kit

symptoms: Hardware kit incomplete (missing bolts, T-nuts, washers)
Entire components missing (seat, pedal plate, brackets)
solutions: Check ALL packaging material - parts sometimes ship loose
Cross-reference received items against the parts list in the manual
Take photos of everything received for documentation
Contact support with: Order number, specific missing part names/quantities, photos of what was received
commonIssues.expectedResolution: Missing parts typically ship within 5-10 business days
commonIssues.escalation: If no response within 48 hours, follow up. Reference ticket number.
preventionTips: Check parts before disposing of packaging

symptoms: Dents or scratches on aluminum profiles
solutions: Document damage with clear photos before assembly
Note damage on delivery receipt if possible
Contact support within 48 hours of delivery
Request replacement part, not just store credit
For significant damage, request full replacement or return
requiredInfo: Photos of damaged product from multiple angles
commonIssues.expectedResolution: Replacement parts ship within 7-14 business days
commonIssues.escalation: If offered inadequate store credit, politely request actual replacement

symptoms: Instructions don't match current product version
Parts not labeled - have to guess
solutions: Check online manuals at trakracer.com/pages/assembly-manuals
Search YouTube for 'Trak Racer [product] assembly'
For monitor stands, reference smaller version instructions and adapt
Take photos during assembly in case you need to backtrack
Join r/simracing Discord for community help
helpfulResources: YouTube: Barry Rowland Trak Racer builds

symptoms: Bolts go in at an angle
solutions: Loosen adjacent bolts to allow flex for alignment
Assemble loosely first, then tighten in sequence
For minor misalignment, use a round file to slightly enlarge hole
Contact support if holes are significantly off - may need replacement part
preventionTips: Don't fully tighten any bolt until all bolts are in place

symptoms: Creaking or squeaking when shifting weight
solutions: Tighten all seat slider mounting bolts
Check that slider rails are parallel
Add rubber washers under mounting bolts to reduce vibration
Apply white lithium grease to slider rails
For persistent issues, upgrade to aftermarket sliders (Sparco, NRG)
commonIssues.escalation: If slider mechanism is faulty, request warranty replacement

solutions: Document with video showing the fault
Contact support for warranty replacement
Do not attempt to disassemble the slider mechanism
commonIssues.expectedResolution: Warranty replacement slider ships within 7-14 days

symptoms: Pedal plate bends during hard braking
More pronounced with Heusinkveld or high-force pedals
solutions: Add support brackets under pedal plate
Upgrade to reinforced pedal plate for your rig model
Consider TR160 or TR8 Pro for high-force pedals (80kg+ brake force)
DIY: Add aluminum angle brackets for additional rigidity

commonIssues.issue: Wheel deck flex with high-torque wheelbase
symptoms: Wheel deck moves during force feedback
solutions: Ensure all wheel deck bolts are properly tightened
Add reinforcement brackets
Use thread locker (blue Loctite) on mounting bolts
Consider upgrading to reinforced wheel deck
For DD2/R21+ torque, TR160 or TR8 Pro recommended

symptoms: Long wait times for replacement parts
solutions: Keep all communication in writing (email/ticket system)
Follow up every 48-72 hours with ticket reference number
Be specific about what resolution you want
Escalate via social media (Twitter/X) if no response after 1 week
For EU/UK: Reference consumer protection rights if applicable
Credit card chargeback as last resort for non-delivery
preventionTips: Keep order confirmations and tracking info

solutions: Use VESA spacers if monitors are too close to arm pivots
Loosen all joints, position monitors, then tighten in sequence
For 300x300 VESA: community reports adapter quality issues - consider aftermarket
Check that all monitor arms are on same side of uprights
helpfulResources: YouTube: Triple monitor stand alignment tutorials

frequentQuestions.question: How long does shipping take?
frequentQuestions.answer: Domestic shipping typically 5-10 business days. International 2-4 weeks. Large rigs ship freight and may require appointment delivery.

frequentQuestions.question: Can I return my rig if I don't like it?
frequentQuestions.answer: Returns accepted within 30 days of delivery in original packaging. Customer pays return shipping. Restocking fee may apply.

frequentQuestions.question: What tools do I need for assembly?
frequentQuestions.answer: Allen keys (included), adjustable wrench, rubber mallet helpful, power drill optional for faster assembly. Level recommended.

frequentQuestions.question: How long does assembly take?
frequentQuestions.answer: TR80: 2-3 hours. TR120: 3-4 hours. TR160: 4-5 hours. TR8 Pro: 5-6 hours. Add 1-2 hours for monitor stands.

frequentQuestions.question: Will my wheelbase fit?
frequentQuestions.answer: All major wheelbases are compatible. Fanatec, Moza, Simagic, Thrustmaster, Logitech all have mounting solutions. Check torque rating matches rig capability.

frequentQuestions.question: What's the weight limit?
frequentQuestions.answer: Most rigs support 120-150kg (265-330lbs) user weight. Check specific model specs for exact rating.

frequentQuestions.question: Can I upgrade my rig later?
frequentQuestions.answer: Yes! 40-series aluminum profile is standard. Monitor stands, shifter mounts, and accessories can be added. Wheel/pedal mounting systems are swappable.

frequentQuestions.question: Is the TR80 enough for a direct drive wheel?
frequentQuestions.answer: TR80 handles up to 8Nm well. For CSL DD at 5-8Nm, it's fine. For DD1 (20Nm) or higher, recommend TR120 or TR160 for rigidity.

frequentQuestions.question: Do I need the pedal slider kit?
frequentQuestions.answer: Not required but recommended if multiple people use the rig or you want easy adjustment. Adds slight height to pedal deck.

frequentQuestions.question: What seat should I get?
frequentQuestions.answer: GT seat for long sessions and comfort. RS6 for tighter bolstering and sportier feel. Both work for most users under 6'2" (188cm).

proTips.detail: Barry Rowland and other YouTubers have detailed build videos that show what the manual doesn't
Organize hardware by size, identify all profiles before starting. Makes assembly 50% faster

proTips.tip: Don't fully tighten until the end
proTips.detail: Leave all bolts finger-tight during assembly, then do a final tighten pass in sequence

proTips.tip: Use blue Loctite on critical bolts
proTips.detail: Wheel deck and pedal plate bolts benefit from thread locker to prevent loosening
Use a bubble level on the wheel deck and seat. Adjust feet as needed for stability
If you need to troubleshoot later or contact support, photos of your build help
r/simracing and sim racing Discord servers have people who've solved every issue
